result.execSummary:
The defendant Quentin Q.D. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, excluding any applicable mandatory surcharges. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable, but waived. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to No Violent Contact. The children are removed from the No Contact Order.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
- Obtain/maintain employment. Receive job search help.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quentin Q.D. Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Quentin Q.D. Brown in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Quentin Q.D. Brown in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 4.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/11/15.
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.  The children are removed from the no contact order.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Due to financial hardhip, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, excluding any applicable mandatory surcharges.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable but is waived.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.  Receive job search help.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Due to Branch 4 in trial, case transferred to Branch 40 for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Quentin Q.D. Brown in court with attorney Mark Dluzak.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-16-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Tyara D., Breanna D., Kimberly D., no guns in possession, cooperate with Justice Point Supervision and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tyara D.; Breanna D. or Kimberly D.

Defendant Quentin Q.D. Brown in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Quentin Q.D. Brown in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
